newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean stocks open up, 720 pts seen as barrier.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean stocks open up, 720 pts seen as barrier.

text.p: South Korean stocks opened higher on Monday, led by a rally of export industries, but brokers saw selling increasing when the index touches the 720-point level.
Buying in exporter shares was based on hopes that the Japanese yen's recent gains against the U.S. dollar would help boost competitiveness of South Korean exporters.
The composite index was up 10.13 points, or 1.43 percent, to 716.38 points after the first 25 minutes of trading.
"Gains are across the board, but many blue chips that rose sharply last week will face profit-taking selling later today," said Chang Kun-woo of Daishin Securities.
